website_summaries.verdict: Bose's latest bluetooth speaker option that easily beats out the competition.
pros: A streamlined model with rugged construction
Has rich, deep base, and will play for 12 hours per charge
The best sound you can get in a speaker this size
cons: Sounds better the further you sit from it – not great sound for listening right next to you

customer_reviews.title: I actually like this product
customer_reviews.text: I actually like this product. The sound is amazing for such a small bluetooth speaker. However, about a month after I bought it, the speaker couldn't get charged. I contacted Bose and sent it back for repairing. This week I got it back, and it was working as brand new. But, today it won't charge again! It's been like 5 days since I got it back!.. Maybe this defect is rare. I have another Bose headphone and it's been working well for 2 years. I really like the design and innovations of Bose products. But this time I'm done with it and I'm returning it. btw, the Amazon service is really helping and considerate.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Charging not right
customer_reviews.text: Currently writing this review whilst listening to my Bose mini soundlink (purchased 2013). Got the revolver today—no AC adapter, charges with an android cable. That being said, when it’s on low battery, it won’t play music even when the charger is plugged in. I’m sickened I have to go through the return process. This is not what I’ve come to expect from Bose. If you can’t play music when it’s on low battery even while plugged in, what’s the point?! My old speaker does this with no problem!! Might consider ordering a bose mini soundlink II. Super disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: MARLENE LAROSE

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE: THIS IS NOT THE SAME BOSE QUALITY WE HAVE COME TO TRUST IN PREVIOUS BOSE SPEAKERS.
customer_reviews.text: This is not the superior quality and great sound that I have had with past Bose products. Does not hold charge for more than couple hours. It did not even come with an aux cord or the wireless charger that my previous Bose came with. Not the Bose quality speaker im used to. My previous Bose speakers have been amazing this is nothing more than dollar store paperweight. Do not waste your time or money on it.
customer_reviews.author: Theo K.

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker when it worked
customer_reviews.text: Great speaker when it worked. I received it on December 21st and it stopped working by mid February! I tried all the recommended "reset" procedures to no avail. I expected MUCH better quality and life for the $200.00 price tag and from a brand name speaker such as Bose. Honestly, my Oontz angle 3 ultra sounds as good and cost less than 1/4 the price at $40.00. I will update this review with my return experience from Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Robert &.

customer_reviews.title: Spectacular sound, compact design
customer_reviews.text: Holy buckets!!! This speaker is AMAZING!! Bought it for listening to Pandora at the lake and don’t regret spending the money at all. Until you hear it, you’d never believe such remarkable sound could come out of a little speaker. Crisp, sharp tones, hold a charge good enough to listen all day long. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Paula

customer_reviews.title: Beware, this is not your fathers Bose systems quality.
customer_reviews.text: It worked for just 3 months then would no longer charge. Id say beware, this is not the bose quality that I was used to before with my speakers. Very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Myers

customer_reviews.title: Great sound. Need charging gear sent
customer_reviews.text: No usb plug or cable to charge unit. Great sound. Need charging gear sent
customer_reviews.author: Ian beaver

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding
customer_reviews.text: This speaker is outstanding. The sound it creates fills the room and has plenty of depth & bass. I purchased the small speaker and can't imagine needing the large one. I would highly recommend this speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Bohanon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome sound. Used for the music at our outdoor wedding ceremony. All 120 people could hear the music just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Merford

customer_reviews.title: fail
customer_reviews.text: complete fail one speaker will not connect to bluetooth after 4 weeks link is spotty at best distance for speaker link capability is week, 1st and 2nd floor just won't happen, distance is 10-15 feet at best on 1st floor terrible product over all even the sound quality just IS NOT Bose update: now the second speaker can’t even be turned up within 2 increments of full as its “blown” on the bass notes 5 weeks in and I can’t return either, AMAZON WAS ZERO HELP ON THIS ONE STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT !!!!
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: This little monster is amazing. 5 Star for sound
customer_reviews.text: While I read the reviews I rarely make one. This little monster is amazing. 5 Star for sound, size, connectivity and construction. Never had anything connect so easy, and reconnects without having to go to settings.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: If Could Would give it ZERO stars
customer_reviews.text: Horrible speaker. I had to send it back 3 times.... It didn't work. first battery, then bluetooth.... horrible speaker. Also, if you play music at very low volume it turns off! What a stupid thing is this? I always want the music very soft while working!! HORRIBLE
customer_reviews.author: Damián Allegretti

customer_reviews.title: Charger port fails, complete waste of otherwise good hardware.
customer_reviews.text: I loved this speaker, great sound and aesthetics, except it started failing to charge about a year in and finally died altogether. This literally sat in my office and never moved, so it's not like I was hard on it. Absolutely ridiculous problem for a $200 speaker, and it only has a 1 year warranty. Perfect hardware that could have lasted decades, rendered useless by a bad charging port. Other reviews have mentioned the same problem; Bose should have done a recall or honored a refurbishing or replacement beyond the warranty window for this issue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Stopped charging--congenital defect!!
customer_reviews.text: Fine print says it is trashed if you dont unplug it entirely when not in use. Of course, only read that when the speaker stopped working after a couple of months. Ultimate example of built-in self-destruct strategy by a company that should be shamed by this cynical approach to product "design". Lots of other reviews say the same thing. This is not user error. This is Trump-era contempt for the consumer.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof, incredible sound.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a contractor, musical worship leader and an audiophile. This unit is remarkable! I take it on jobsites all the time, use it for musical practice, and take it anywhere we want quality music (hiking, biking, camping, hanging out outside/inside). It can truly take a beating, it's sound is accurate sonically and is a tremendous speaker for portabikity, accuracy...and simply enjoyment of music. Get one. You don't have to baby it.
customer_reviews.author: SPeck

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy!
customer_reviews.text: This is the BIGGEST WASTE OF MONEY! It worked great for the first year, after that it began cutting out. Mow I can't even get through 1 song before it cuts out and eont come on for sometime 10 min or more. This is year 2 and I can't use it. I've followed all the trouble shooting instructions, still cutting out. As for BOSE support what a joke, what support! Biggest waste of $200. I'll NEVER buy another BOSE product again!
customer_reviews.author: Freedom Through Strength

customer_reviews.title: Decent, but quirky bluetooth speaker...
customer_reviews.text: Very portable, good sound quality. The only negative is if your phone is paired to the bluetooth speaker, the speaker prompts you to answer incoming calls through the speaker itself! It does this every single time, and sometimes takes over (i.e. it intercepts the call and prompts you to answer, before the call even starts to ring on the phone). If you answer the call on your phone, you pretty much have to disconnect the bluetooth connection.
customer_reviews.author: rufino b.

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker bad firmware
customer_reviews.text: Love the speaker but please don't do the firmware update. Everything works and sounds good just like all my other Bose products. Did the recommended firmware update and lost all volume control not only one the speaker but from any device I paired it to. Bose is finally replacing the speaker after sending it to be repaired after only having it 2 days getting it back and still no volume control. Purchased on July 20, 2018 and as of August 22, 2018 still have no speaker. Bose needs to fix this problem as I am not the only one having it. When a replacement gets here and it works will be more than happy to increase rating.
customer_reviews.author: ron garner

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working
customer_reviews.text: Stopped charging a little over a month of having it. I can't figure out what's wrong with it, but I'm stuck with it since it stopped working just outside of the return window.
customer_reviews.author: Tron

customer_reviews.title: Good luck
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of the gushing reviews, the unit I received did not and would not link to another Bose Revolve. Take a look at the Support page at Bose and the number of complaints regarding this product's inability to link up. Yeah I know it's so wonderful; no problems; just look at the percentage ratio of stars awarded; blah, blah, blah. By itself it is wonderful, BUT THAT IS NOT WHY I BOUGHT IT.
customer_reviews.author: sfcape

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use with Bluetooth devices.
customer_reviews.text: Using this at the office all day. Battery lasts a long time. Charges quickly. Picks up all the Bluetooth devices on its own. Don't need to be a "Techie" to figure it out! Have another brand speaker that takes ten minutes to pair with my iPad or MP3. This one is so easy.
customer_reviews.author: Goldfish

customer_reviews.title: Really read the reviews before purchasing
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. I got it as a Mother’s Day gift from my daughter. I wouldn’t have bought if I had made the purchase and had read the review. I had a problem, contacted amazon and they transferred me to Bose. I sent it to be serviced just got it back and the first time trying to charge again it didn’t charge 😡. I contacted amazon for a refund they are only reimbursing 80% because it passed the date. I wouldn’t be returning just now if it wasn’t working anymore. Very disappointed with Amazon and the product
customer_reviews.author: Andreia Amaral

customer_reviews.title: Good,  but not great
customer_reviews.text: First, I will admit Im a big bose fan. I wanted to love this revolve. The sound is really good, but not as full as my soundbar mini that it replaced. Part of that may be the 360 degree soundscape. It does sound better in a corner. If you’re entertaining, putting it in the middle of the room let’s everyone hear sound equally well. Pairs perfectly. Not a big fan of the Siri connection. Why would I keep pressing a button when I can just say hey siri to my phone.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dillinger

customer_reviews.title: SoundLink to AM Radio Sound
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always equated Bose with quality, but no more. I’ve had two SoundDocks and no matter what genre, classical to bass heavy they delivered. I put it on a floating shelf made of solid wood in a corner of my not open concept kitchen and I might’ve well been playing an AM radio. GREAT for classical, soft rock, easy listening type music. This is NOT for bass/treble, my Altec Lansing mini h20 2 (5 inch wide 2 inch tall) surpasses this Bose speaker. I guess there are more easy listening customers to cater too than an across the board genre customer like myself.
customer_reviews.author: Tamika

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly impressive for the size
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this Bose Soundlink Revolve for a small 1000sf condo. It was very easy to connect with Bluetooth. We let our 16 year old son choose the music and he selected something with lots of base. We had to immediately ask him to turn down the volume. It filled the main living space quite easily with surprisingly good sound and no distortion. The base would have been impressive for a speaker twice its size and it was not even half way to max volume. We are quite pleased with this purchase and will likely purchase another for our lakehouse. We have not yet tested the reliability of the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Kellye Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Sound
customer_reviews.text: Have a high end audio set up in the house but a family member thinks its too complicated so they play music through their iPhone speakers or a cheap separate speaker. Couldn't stand it anymore so got them one of these - awesome sound no longer driving me crazy - can fill a pretty large room. Would to get another to link for stereo which would be even better but that would raise the complexity factor for the user so standing down for now.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: the buttons trying to tunr it off and on were terrible. I have now bought a Sonas and the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been a BOSE customer for over 30 years. I order this Bose Revolve and the sound, the buttons trying to tunr it off and on were terrible. I have now bought a Sonas and the sound and ease of operation outweighs the Bose. I feel like I am loosing a friend since I have been with Bose to long. Their design and technology have not kept up with other companies
customer_reviews.author: laurie Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great speaker 😁
customer_reviews.text: Been having this speaker for about 5 months if not more and it’s really good. Love that for its size it can get loud and the bass isn’t too much. The battery life isn’t bad, I sometimes lay on the living room couch and just bump music for at least 5hrs and doesn’t die. If they have the payment option again (which I think they randomly have it) i might buy another one just to try party mode lol. It’s costly but really recommend this speaker, maybe get the new version if you want to take it out with you because that one has a handle
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo

customer_reviews.title: The runt of the litter
customer_reviews.text: All of my other Bose products work flawlessly; Bose noise cancelling headphones, Bose Wave radio, etc. There are many issues with this speaker. 1. When not playing music, the speaker will make a hissing sound. 2. After one year, my speaker is no longer operational. It no longer holds a charge 3. Sometimes, I need to disconnect and then re-connect the blutooth when connected to an Alexa device or it stutters. For this price and brand, I expect better.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Battery doesn’t last no where near 12 hours
customer_reviews.text: This is worst product on the market especially thinking Bose was a good product to purchase well had it for one day charged to 100% battery came to work today and in as little as 3 hours this speaker went dead on me I had better luck with a cheap model from Walmart for 20.00 not 200.00 Bose I would be ashamed of myself to produce and sale like this battery is to last up to 12 hours what volume level did u test this product on level one? Boxing it up when I get home and it’s being returned unreal DO NOT BUY WORST PRODUCT THAT I HAVE EVER BOUGHT!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Smarthome34

customer_reviews.title: The battery will stop charging
customer_reviews.text: It's only a matter of time. Like many one star reviews my battery stopped charging within a month. I asked for a replacement, but they wanted to service it so I sent it in. They replaced the battery and it worked again for a few more months then, but eventually the battery gave out and it stopped charging. I left it alone for a week and it began charging again randomly. Then another few months went by and it stopped charging yet again. It's got great sound, so it's unfortunate that this model has so many issues with the battery.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Excellent BUT...
customer_reviews.text: With the Latest 2019 Samsung TV I found that I still need avantree To boost the volume signal. Once I got that, these are amazing. Is it worth it, for me it is. I am very particular and because I live in a apartment, having a good level ( I don't like headphones) that is close to me so it doesn't bother other people is very important. I have both this one in the smaller one.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Weissman

customer_reviews.title: What a letdown
customer_reviews.text: I have a few products from Bose, so I'm familiar with the quality they produce. This speaker was a letdown. It's not very loud at all, and doesn't produce the lows. I know its not a large speaker, I wasn't expected big thundering bass, but give me something. Because of the price of the product I was expecting to be blown away, I'm sending it back after only 4 days. The only positive is that the speaker is 360 degrees around. Another reviewer compared it to their cell phone having a very good speaker, I totally agree. I ordered a JBL to replace this Bose. If this product was half the price I paid, I may have kept it.
customer_reviews.author: Phil C.

customer_reviews.title: Music, Clear Mids, Mono & Movies
customer_reviews.text: I took the leap in hopes of replacing my Bose Mini Soundlink II Special Edition but I have to tell you I have found the Soundlink Revolver lacking in a few categories, mostly based on the engineered circular orientation, that have become very important to me, that being music separation (instruments coming from different distinctive angles), clear, distinct, and separate mids, left to right/ right to left separation when watching movies on my laptop or ipad. I just received it yesterday and honestly I'm still not sure if I'll be keeping it for music only which sounds like it's in mono mode. I've fiddled with my equalizer and I'm flummoxed.
customer_reviews.author: OJ

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I used to have an older version of this which was very nice, but it suddenly stopped working. I bought this one as a replacement and have been very disappointed. It does not receive Bluetooth signals that well. It has trouble receiving a signal more than 12 feet away. My biggest complaint is the auto-on feature. There is no way to disable it. When I turn it off, I want it to stay off and not turn on when it detects a Bluetooth signal from a paired device. But that's not possible with this version. The sound quality is good, but the annoyances far outweigh that. I'm going to look for another brand to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: c-go

customer_reviews.title: Battery Recharge is Faulty
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Bose mini speaker I have had. Sound quality is fine. However, after about a dozen recharges, the system no longer will recharge despite following instructions for rebooting, updating software, etc. I returned the first speaker multiple times and the same thing happened each time. In my opinion, Bose has a serious problem with their battery system. I am not alone in experiencing this problem. I used to respect Bose as a company, but no longer. Highly disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bose doing what they do best
customer_reviews.text: Audiophiles love to knock Bose because they DSP the snot out of everything they produce. But there are situations where this technical prowess actually comes in handy. This speaker is the size of a beer can and nothing can beat the sound reproduction that comes from larger drivers and bigger enclosures. But Bose has mastered the art/science of getting the best possible sound out of something the size of a beer can. If you need something small and portable, you could do a lot worse than the Revolve. It won't fill a large room. But it will sit on your desk or patio and do just fine. Everything works and the build quality is second to none.
customer_reviews.author: Mr_Fastbucks

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished or No???
customer_reviews.text: I am quite curious as to the origin of this speaker. Of course, Bose sound quality is present and the design/materials are outstanding, but something has me puzzled. There are obvious signs of wear on the bottom of the speaker. Case in point....the serial number on my unit is partially worn off right out of the box. I just received this item today, Monday August 17th 2020. How is this possible?! I'd like an explanation from Amazon or Bose.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Pinson

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 JBL charge 3's for less than one of these.
customer_reviews.text: Sound quality was okay, but if your expecting the legendary BOSE sound experience, be prepared for disappointment. My JBL charge 3 sounds better, goes louder, and produces WAY mor bass. In the description Bose stated simple, seamless conection to google home and alexa. Nope. I liked Bose, but that statement is false. Based on the sound quality and the false advertising, it's unlikely that I'll ever look at bose products again.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly LeFevre

customer_reviews.title: A right piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: 1. the plug for the charging cable does not go all the way into the device, it sticks out about an 8th/quarter of an inch 2. spontaneously drops connections to devices, difficult to get it back on 3. just unplugged it from cable after charging over night, "Battery 90%" really? So battery never charges to 100 4. the base (sold separately) is terrible! plug cannot stay in it If I could return it I would. Sound quality is ok Avoid this product it is genuinely bad engineering Update: still worst piece of junk I’ve ever purchased from amazon
customer_reviews.author: DCW

customer_reviews.title: Love the sound
customer_reviews.text: I live in a 2 bdr apartment and am considerate of neighbors, but, I like to have music playing in the background during most of the day when I'm home. The sound on this is clear and crisp w/notable bass, but not boomy kind. I don't have to set it loudly to enjoy because this unit plays so nicely. I have it blue-toothed my an Alexa dot and am very happy w/ the combo.
customer_reviews.author: SonoraTop Contributor: Makeup

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great.
customer_reviews.text: The speaker itself is built nicely and has good tone. A bit disappointed with volume, as it is not quite as loud as I had expected, but absolutely fits the bill. My one gripe is really the app, and specifically, connecting 2 speakers to play in unison, which it can do, but the method to do so is frustrating and more difficult than it should be. Therefore, I kept 1 star.
customer_reviews.author: H M Simon

customer_reviews.title: Good but Not what I was hoping for...
customer_reviews.text: This was just OK, I was a bit disappointed in it being a Bose. Expected the sound to be better. Cannot report on battery life as I only used for one day before returning it. I got a Beats Pill+ (about $10 more) instead and feel the sound, quality and style is better.
customer_reviews.author: Marc & Julie B | RVLove

customer_reviews.title: Great Sound for its Size
customer_reviews.text: The sound is great for its size. It goes pretty loud and has amazing bass. Highs could be better but the speaker does great for being a single driver unit. The 360 degree sound is great. Sound is projected well around the speaker. Battery life is good. Meets its 12 hour claim at moderate volumes and lasts about 8-9 hours at loud volumes. My only complaint is that the aluminum body scratches really easily but I don't mind since I am using it at a rough environment at work.
customer_reviews.author: SandmanSXi

customer_reviews.title: Connection stutters when using WiFi connections
customer_reviews.text: Bose seems to be having issues translating their usual high quality product to Bluetooth. This purchase was our 3rd Bose Bluetooth device. I had to throw away the Bose Micro Soundlink after 2 years of use as it would constantly disconnect and finally died completely. I use the Bose Mini now, but it has started dying at random after one year of use. We purchased the Revolve because the Bose clarity and sound is very high quality, but from Day 1, it started skipping and stuttering while using Pandora or Spotify. Can't do it anymore, Bose... Exchanged for the UE Megablast and very happy so far!
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Marie

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy stuff like this online, go to a local store
customer_reviews.text: My Bose Soundlink Revolve was working great for about a month. All of a sudden we got no sound out of it. We disconnected and reset the unit and could not connect again. After working with support over (painful) text messages for about a week we can connect but get no sound. Bose won't respond, Amazon does not care and defers to Bose. I now have a $200 paper weight on my desk. I'll keep trying to get it replaced but as of now it's just frustrating and so I've decided to write this review it would deter someone else from buying this product from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Island

customer_reviews.title: Will not charge
customer_reviews.text: Bought this product in November 2019 and loved it in every way until about a month ago. Sounds great, connectivity is great, looks great.... but now it won't charge. It works fine as long as it's plugged in but unplug it and instantly get a message that the battery is critically low and must be charged. According to the reviews this problem is not uncommon, stupid me, I should have checked the reviews BEFORE I purchased. But dang it... it's a Bose! They have a long standing reputation for producing top of the line products, I guess that's not so true anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas W Bradshaw

customer_reviews.title: Will not take a charge, crappy
customer_reviews.text: Can you give a zero star review? I read all the reviews, thought I made a sound choice and unfortunately I got a dud. Bought it in February 2020 and just 2 weeks ago, the end of May it will not take a charge. Of course the return window was in March so I just spent money on something that I can not even return for a new one. Very very upset and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Nanc

customer_reviews.title: Best Bose Bluetooth Speaker I've Owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bluetooth speaker. I've had this for over 18 months and it hasn't ever let me down. Sound quality is excellent. The automatic bass, midrange, and treble system seem perfect for whatever I'm playing. I've owned several Bose products and have never been disapointed. The say it's waterproof but won't be testing that feature. This is by far the best Bose speaker I've had. Their prices are a little on the high side but I guess you get what you pay for. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: LunaPhi

customer_reviews.title: Will NOT Charge
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for our son. He used it was a few short months, then it quit charging. Now as we attempt to set up service, the serial number is impossible to locate on the speaker and the entire troubleshooting process is not helpful or user-friendly. Frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: KSaginak

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to use Speaker
customer_reviews.text: Sound was good when I got it to work. Had to reset bluetooth every time I turned on the computer, plus the USB and RCA connections did not work, plus the unit died after 6.5 months. Enough said.
customer_reviews.author: Paul T. Finger MD

customer_reviews.title: This product has a major design flaw!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this speaker! It stopped charging after 6 weeks. The cord and charging cradle are fine. The battery flashes red and won’t charge! And wouldn’t you know Amazon says I missed the return window by a week. So it’s going back to Bose to be repaired. There are several reviews that I read stating the speaker was repaired by Bose only to have the same problem again within weeks! I just lost faith in Bose products. I’ll post the outcome of this once I get it back.
customer_reviews.author: john korytko

customer_reviews.title: Terrible sound quality. Should cost $50 and I still wouldn’t buy it over the competition
customer_reviews.text: Excellent build quality, but now worth worth $200. It’s sounds like something that should cost no more than $50-60. There sound is low quality with horrible mids. Sounds like your are listening to your phone speaker in a cup with added bass. Both the Anker souncore boost and Klipsch groove sound better than this costing around $70. Even Bose’s soundlink mini II sounds better and is cheaper. I wanted something with high quality sound. Only thing you’ll find in this speaker is good construction and battery life, but horrible sound quality. Maybe the revolve+ is better, but I’m hesitant to try it now.
customer_reviews.author: Gurpreet Rangi

customer_reviews.title: 1000% Satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: Every once in a while you have to splurge on items that are important to you. Music is a huge part of my life, and I literally listen to this thing for 5-6 hours a day. The sound is full, crisp and quite loud on some friday nights. It seems to play endlessly even when not plugged in (10+ hours easy at lower volumes). Its been to countless beach trips, park jams, backyard parties etc and everyone is always jelly. Its also built like a tank, but isn't incredibly heavy. Buy one. I'll buy you ice cream if you regret it.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: Have always been a Bose fan
customer_reviews.text: Amazing as usual sound quality and ease of use. A friend had one of their other speakers that is more of a sound bar shap and we really liked that one. Saw this model and read so reviews and I was sold. Was not remotely disappointed in the richness and the spatial spread of this model. Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. Edmonds

customer_reviews.title: Nice form factor, battery life; muddy, too much bass
customer_reviews.text: Given its strong reviews on Amazon, I picked up the Bose Revolv for portable music listening in my home. Unfortunately, it sounds like when you initially get into a rental car and the bass is maxed to the point where you can't even really make out the words of your music. Really unfortunate that the EQ isn't adjustable (especially given that the speaker has app support). I trust that the speaker is capable of good playback, it's just limited by its software, I suspect. I'd expect this sound from a $50 speaker. Not a $200 one.
customer_reviews.author: tateltot

customer_reviews.title: Wow. Makes everything else seem pathetic.
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe how much I love this speaker. The buttons are a little hard to read for a 50+ adult, but otherwise it’s to die for. I sincerely didn’t know sound like this from such a little speaker. Bose has done it again! I would enthusiastically recommend this to everyone!
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Battery indicator not working!!
customer_reviews.text: Got this speaker today, the battery indicator was not even working out of the box, tried multiple times turning it on and off, still not even a single flash. There was no instruction other than downloading the app and had to google to find online pdf manual. Plus when it's hooked up to my computer using USB, it picks up every single static noise. I returned and got a new one with working indicator lights this time. Less than 6 months later, the speaker won't charge!!! What a piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: The sound is amazing as expected from Bose. And the design and color goes perfectly with my desk set up. I gave 4 starts out of 5 on the Bluetooth connection. If you leave your room with your phone that is linked and go to another close by space of your house the connection starts to glitch. Other than that is perfect. Really happy with my purchase :)
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: It has great sound quailty but there are problems in battery charging
customer_reviews.text: I was pretty happy about it for about 8 month, the sound is great and battery last decent amount of time. Then the nightmare begun. One day it just wouldn't charge by any means, USB, wall outlet. So I called Bose and they said they will fix it. Think that's the end of the story? Nah it's just the beginning. Since then I had the same problem on Apr, Aug and November, and right now this piece of equipment stopped charning again After I sent it for fixing 3 times. Now they agree to give me a replacement but god knows how long will that last?
customer_reviews.author: Harry Redknapp

customer_reviews.title: Excellent speaker! A bit pricey, but you’re paying for great quality.
customer_reviews.text: Considering the vast amount of alternatives, we purchased this model unsure how the quality would be compared to other portable speakers. From the first moment we played a song, we were astonished by the sound quality! This little speaker packs a punch, and truly fills the room with deep, rich audio. It’s hard to describe, but even with the volume set at a moderate level, the acoustics carry further and fill the space without distortion. The sound is so realistic that when commercials pop up (when listening to Pandora) it confuses our dog, as the clarity and depth of the person’s voice sounds like they’re truly in the room! Amazing!
customer_reviews.author: Nell Mulrooney

customer_reviews.title: Excellent sound quality, but Bluetooth never worked right.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice package here -- sound comes out from all directions around lower half of speaker. So you can put it in the middle of a room or table and everyone gets great audio. Sound Pressure Level ("loudness"): It can crank! Only two quibbles: 1. You *can* overdrive it -- YouTube for e.g. Just lower the YouTube volume slider and turn up the speaker volume to compensate. 2. Price. Ouch. 3. One year later: Folks, the Bluetooth just never really worked right -- constant conflicts or just not pairing. It's not the other devices, it's this. Given the ENDLESS frustration this causes, I just can't recommend it and I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Dag Spicer

customer_reviews.title: What you pay what you get
customer_reviews.text: Bose have high quality speakers product and headphone. Of course all Bose's product are pricey. Include that speaker. You got a high quality of sounds from Bose. I used some cheap bluetooth speakers before, they are OK if you not require high quality of sounds. Overall that Bose speakers has better sounds, quick bluetooth connections. Very loud sounds and portable to carry it around the house. Would like to recommend you buy that speaker if you can afford and want good sounds
customer_reviews.author: dnschan

customer_reviews.title: Love, love this speaker....
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome bluetooth speaker. I chose Bose because of its reputation and a name brand. I paid more than many of the competitors, but it was well worth the extra investment. Two of my friends who have heard it have gone ahead and ordered one for themselves. The sound is awesome, a nice deep base...but not overwhelming....along with clear quality range in the mids and highs as well. I highly recommend this speaker...
customer_reviews.author: G. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Problems with Charging!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this item on prime day, had to return it 2 days later...I plugged it to be charged and after 24 hrs it had only charged 20% so, Left it a bit longer just so it could drop tp 10%....their is many reviews with ppl having the same problem. Maybe this are refurbished. Whatever the case is I sent it back, not worth the headache!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Velderrain

customer_reviews.title: Great for in home Soul Cycle and Peloton classes!
customer_reviews.text: I literally waited the entire day for this to arrive until I did my Soul Cycle class on the Variis app. So worth the wait! I have been using the the Bose Soundlink mini 2, which has been great but wanted to elevate to a new music level. Make sure to put it somewhere it is not up against something so all side can bounce of the walls. It really is so good. It ended up not working for every room we needed it for so returned it but for a small workout room, it is great.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa M. Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected from Bose
customer_reviews.text: Pretty mediocre compared to other lower priced devices. I guess it works pretty great when paired with my phone but when paired with my Firestick and the volume control is dependent on the speaker itself, forget it. It sucks. The battery life is awesome but it gets stuck on charging at 90% for days and days so I have a feeling the battery is already getting old at less than 6 months.
customer_reviews.author: Spendi

customer_reviews.title: "Ready to pair"
customer_reviews.text: If you unpair your smartphone with the bose and the bose speaker is turned on it will continue say "ready to pair" every few minutes....forever. So ultimately you cannot just keep the bose speaker on unless you always want to be paired with the speaker while at home. Horrible design flaw and makes the devise almost unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Farrell

customer_reviews.title: Sounds very good.  Looks very good.  Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: The Bose Revolve speaker sounds very good, looks very good and is easy to use. I paired it to an iPhone 6, Motorola X 2nd Gen Android and a Windows 10 laptop. It is located in our Kitchen/Sun Room where we spend most of our time together as a family when we are home. We now can enjoy listening to music together. It sounds very good and easily fills the 12'x20' area. It is located in the middle of the area on the center island and because of the design of the speaker (downward facing speaker), it sounds great from anywhere in the room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer RDD

customer_reviews.title: VERY Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: The Bose stopped charging after only about six months. I really liked it, but am disappointed at how quickly it stopped working because it won't charge. So, it's not worth the $200.00 I spent on it.
customer_reviews.author: Georgia

customer_reviews.title: Amazing sound little speaker! Very satisfying purchase
customer_reviews.text: I got the silver one. Simple yet cool looking, small yet powerful. Bluetooth works great through wall. Although I love the speaker I returned the charging cradle. Like other reviewers said it has serious design flaw on the bottom where the cable is supposed to be connected, it can’t be properly used. Besides the one I received was a defect (a cable connection issue) it wouldn’t charge. The charging light blinked once and then it stoped and wouldn’t charge. The speaker is perfect itself without a charging cradle. If it worked and I decided to keep it l, I would’ve been annoyed every time the cradle moved and the cable connection got disconnected. I’m 100% happy with the speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Jules

customer_reviews.title: Amazing little speaker!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve owned various releases of portable Bose speakers, going back to the days of the dongle. This one is superior to them all. Bluetooth? Check! Good battery life? Check! Can be plugged in? Check! Portable? CHECK! Not too bassy as many previous Bose efforts have been. Only down side is there are no controls other than volume so you can’t do any EQing at all. But pound for pound and dollar for dollar, this is a great device.
customer_reviews.author: PaulG

customer_reviews.title: No longer charges
customer_reviews.text: I would have originally given this a 3 to 3.5. It's a decent speaker, but over priced. The sound quality is good, but hard to adjust the volume. My reason for giving this 1 star is that I've had it 6 weeks and it will no longer charge. I am returning this product.
customer_reviews.author: SandyLynne

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes it connects, sometimes it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: Nice design and finishing, good sound, etc. Worth nothing if the device connects sometimes but doesn't, without any apparent reason, some other times. Is it the weather? Is it even-numbered days? Really inexplicable. We turn it off, we disconnect all devices, we've tried everything, we are not idiots. This is very annoying and disappointing. Not sure I will buy a Bose next time around and that was all I've been buying for the last (probably) 10 years.
customer_reviews.author: Santiago Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Bose - YES!
customer_reviews.text: I have wanted a Bose speaker for my Kindle for awhile now. I like to take my Kindle outside when I'm sunbathing or when I'm trimming shrubs (I have 42 shrubs to trim each year). All my music is on my Kindle, but the external speaker on the Kindle is not loud enough to appreciate while trimming shrubs. With this Bose speaker I finally have music loud enough to appreciate it while I do these onerous chores. I don't use the bluetooth, I connect the speaker directly to my Kindle and power my Kindle directly to the AC outlet. I never run out of power. It certainly makes the job go faster.
customer_reviews.author: Share-A-Smile

customer_reviews.title: Battery stops charging after four months
customer_reviews.text: I had this product for four months and when I try to charge this product it would not charge via the USB or the additional cradle that I purchased for this product. I tried to reach out to Bose they would not help me because I could not read the serial number that is not visible with the human eye on the bottom of the product. I thought Bose was a more reputable company and was hoping he would stand by their product I’ve had nothing but problems with the speaker. So to pay this much money for a product it only lasts 4 months is definitely a disappointment save your money do not purchase this faulty product.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel P Esparza

customer_reviews.title: Battery Failure
customer_reviews.text: Battery failed, will not charge. To use online support you need a serial number. It claims the serial number is on the bottom of the speaker. There is a lot of tiny spidery writing on the bottom of the speaker, but it is only (barely) legible in certain light (like when Gandalf pulls the one ring from the fire). I like the speaker, but I'm hating the hassle. Save yourself some time, just buy a different speaker that actually works.
customer_reviews.author: Annalisa Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Died after a few uses. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: This speaker was reticent about pairing up with my iPhone from the beginning. It finally did pair after much fiddling around with the speaker and the clunky slow Bose app. I’ve had it since March and used it some but not a lot. Suddenly it just quit working. Doesn’t respond in any way except to display a solid amber battery icon which should mean medium charge. It won’t pair. It won’t play. Doesn’t respond in any way. Very disappointing. I have to question the quality of this item and will not buy again. I do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: aldis

customer_reviews.title: Speaker is great, supplied power cord sucks
customer_reviews.text: The sound from the speaker is amazing as you'd expect from Bose. However the supplied power cord stops charging the speaker after just a few times of plugging it in. I called and Amazon switched it out for me. But sure enough about 6 charges into the new one same thing, the power stopped charging the speaker. I've now ordered the charging base for another $30. So now $210 into this for a Bose speaker that won't charge with supplied power cord, twice and now power base I would expect more from a Bose product.
customer_reviews.author: Ariesrah

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Speaker!
customer_reviews.text: This little speaker is awesome! The sound is great for its size. when you put it in a corner, the bass really comes out! Super impressive for something so small! It also fits it a drink holder on my bike, or a cup holder on my beach chair! It’s really perfect for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Darrel Larson

customer_reviews.title: What the heck Bose?
customer_reviews.text: First mistake was not checking reviews on these puppies, but hey, it’s Bose should I really have to? Got speakers all set up and they sounded great, at first, then I noticed that they weren’t completely charging properly so I did a little research. After reading several different sights, I updated the speakers, that was mistake number 2. Once they had been updated to fix the charging issue they sounded absolutely horrible. They now had nothing but bass and no treble, it’s like someone stole the tweeters. I highly recommend you pass by these and keep looking. I returned the ones I purchased and am upgrading to Sonos...
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love the idea of a tripod screw mount on the ...
customer_reviews.text: Can never go wrong with Bose. Definitely louder in comparison to the Soundlink mini range. Fuller bass sound also. I don’t see the USB charger as a big issue although I wish they provided international adaptors you slide and clip on as they use to do with Bose products. Love the idea of a tripod screw mount on the bottom so you can have it on a tripod in the middle of the room at small get togethers. Bose is always my #1
customer_reviews.author: XJordan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome sound qaulity!
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a portable bluetooth speaker that would mainly provide sound for our kitchen and living room area and this small speaker really does an excellent job. Full, rich, crisp sound is how I would describe it. We really enjoy using it.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.text: this speaker stopped turning on after a couple months of use. cannot get ahold of customer service to use the warranty DO NOT BUY now i have an expensive paperweight go with marshall speakers instead
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s a Bose!
customer_reviews.text: I have several Bose products: Quiet Comfort Noise Cancelling Headphones and a Bose Wave Radio. Being impressed and satisfied with both, I looked towards Bose when I was looking for a portable Bluetooth speaker. I initially wanted to buy the Color Speaker, but the salesman at Best Buy said, try listening to this Revolve Speaker — I did and it was definitely worth the extra cost. It has clear, big and expansive sound for it’s size. I am not disappointed with my purchase. Getting the charging dock for free was a bonus. Pro Tip — buy a padded carrying case to protect the speaker. Remember, it’s portable and you’ll be toting it around outside, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Brian A. ONeill

customer_reviews.title: Mehhh
customer_reviews.text: Well so far I have to this is mediocre at best. The sound is decent but everything else difficult compared to my jbl Bluetooth speaker. I do like being able make and take calls but it’s more button controlled ( too much press n hold this button...press n hold that button, press n hold these buttons simultaneously) than voice. We will keep working on it but so far not real impressed
customer_reviews.author: Livelaughlove

customer_reviews.title: Great sound difficult app
customer_reviews.text: Like the sound but Bose should have an easier app to link two speakers. It should automatically link two of them not the difficult method. Does not have app that I know of. with a great equalizer and turn on and off. Ultimate ears Boom speakers can be turned on remotely and has a good equalizer. I have several boose products, soundboard, head set etc theirvsound is always great
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend the Bose speaker two of them if you can afford it they work really well.
customer_reviews.text: I have to read this speaker I give it mostly a five star It was so good I bought another one so I have two of them for stereo it works extremely well I’ve had the flip for Buy JBL to flip five by JBL I returned most of them because of distortion the Bluetooth cutting in and out you get feedback from the JBL it’s a horrible speaker I don’t recommend buying it but the Bose they work so much better I should’ve bought all of the photos when they were on sale so I highly recommend the Bose speaker.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A Ferraro

customer_reviews.title: we've enjoyed the ease of use and sound quality
customer_reviews.text: I wasnt sure what to get for the house. Finally after reading reviews, i decided on this Bose speaker. Everyone in the house has such different music tastes. This has been a fun purchase, it connects easily with devices and everyone's music sounds so much better coming from it. I love its shape and size too. Subtle addition to the living room but significant improvement in sound quality
customer_reviews.author: KBinard

customer_reviews.title: Usually love Bose but...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in August, 2017 and loved it. Bought another within the last month to be able to link into "party mode". When I tried to link through the app I was told I needed a "firmware" update. Allowed it to update and it fried my speaker, can't even get power now; the original speaker that I am reviewing here is now useless. A lot of money for something I can't use anymore
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Not loud enough
customer_reviews.text: I can believe my 30.00 onyx angle is louder that a speaker with the Bose name on it !! Really disappointed ☹️ I going to send it back
customer_reviews.author: Akd

customer_reviews.title: Pretty loud and great range
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife for Christmas. After making sure it worked I hid it in the pantry in the laundry room. Completely forgot about it until my wife freaked out one night while I was in the garage trying to get my phone to pair to my speaker. She was apparently folding laundry and all the sudden Slip Knot started screaming at her from the cabinet. Glad to know it has a hella long range, kinda ruined the surprise for her though.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Nothing bad about this, just not worth the price tag
customer_reviews.text: So there really isnt anything bad about this speaker, its easy to set up, its nice, good construction. its nice. but its really not that loud and not that crisp and max volume. i put this on my deck and simply need move/higher volume. There is really no difference in this than any $100 speaker out there. I never thought Bose was that good but i thought i would give them another try. Confirmed, not that good.
customer_reviews.author: S.C.P.

customer_reviews.title: Better than JBL?
customer_reviews.text: Sounds fantastic! I was a jbl diehard after going through three of the Charge units (they were great as well, but I was a bit rough with them). I decided to go with Bose this time for the 360° sound system and it is awesome. The battery life isn't quite as good as the Charge, but I get many many many hours out of it. Mostly use the aux function for my music making devices, but the Bluetooth works good from what I've seen!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Grignon

customer_reviews.title: Extreme Quality Sound, Sub Par Bluetooth Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: The battery on this speaker lasts FOREVER. 2.5 hours of play time only brought the power down to 95%. The sound quality is impressive for its size. I use it in both an in home setting and for outdoor events. Bluetooth connectivity is hit or miss. It will be easy to initially connect your device but turning it on and off again is sometimes required to get connectivity. Connectivity issues have also been apparent with connection to a MacBook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Sound not as clear and crisp as expected
customer_reviews.text: I loved the compact size and the sleek look of this speaker. Unfortunately, the sound quality was underwhelming. There is no way to adjust the treble and bass on the speaker and I couldn't find anything to help in the manual. Because the sound comes from the lower half of the speaker, I had to place the speaker on a high surface (eye level or above) to avoid what I thought was a slightly muffled sound. I recognize the Bose name, so I had very high expectations. I'm going to return it and buy an EU speaker instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jenzai

customer_reviews.title: Expensive Junk
customer_reviews.text: Thing died 1 day after the return date. That means I got 1 month's use for $150. I still have my other speaker [the JBL at $130 at 3months use] and it's still working fine. I thought that this bose piece of junk would sound better but it could not even keep up, and started to sound blown out after 3 weeks. The JBL still sounds fine. Just forget this junky bose expense; very disappointing. What happened to bose quality? It's pure toilet. Never buying a bose thing again
customer_reviews.author: aaron summers

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, sounds great.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and connect too. Sounds good, the bass is not as deep as traditional larger speakers but it sounds better than any other portable small speaker I have heard. Great for taking by the pool or enjoying the outdoors. Very simple to use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dont waist your money its a pice of junk
customer_reviews.text: I have a few other bluetooth sound bixes and thought i would go to Bose for more souns and better quality. What a joke. Everything about this soeeker sucks. Connection battery time (3hrs) if you lucky 10 feet from bix maby. Real big disappoint. jbl for 40 dollars beats the hell out if it. Abd so doea the beats by apple
customer_reviews.author: Steve salankey

customer_reviews.title: Good but not the best value
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend buying 2 because this speaker is mono and pairing them gives you stereo. The Bluetooth connectivity is not good and sometimes it disconnects and glitches in the sound output. Also its 10m (30ft) connectivity is incredibly poor for speakers of this range. Examples is cheaper speakers from JBL, Oontz, UE, Tribit, and Sony all have better range and connectivity. On a positive side, good sound quality and bass. Not the best but good. Looks modern and stylish as well.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

product_meta.title: Bose SoundLink Revolve, Portable Bluetooth Speaker (with 360 Wireless Surround Sound), Lux Gray
product_meta.description: Color:Lux Gray| Style:Speaker onlyThe sound link Revolve Bluetooth speaker from Bose is engineered to deliver Deep, loud and immersive sound in every direction. Place it in the center of the room to give everyone the same experience. Or set it near a wall and sound will radiate and reflect around the room, immersing you in that same feeling you felt at your favorite show. The Tapered cylindrical shape makes this wireless speaker easy to grab and go. Its durable aluminum body provides worry-free protection, and its water-resistant design lets you keep the party going, even if it starts to rain. The rechargeable, lithium-ion battery plays up to 12 hours—for full-day listening. Voice prompts talk you through wireless Bluetooth pairing, and you can easily take calls with the built-in speakerphone. You can even access Siri or Google now right from your speaker. Pair two sound link Revolve speakers in party mode for more performance. Or put them in stereo mode: instruments and vocals will naturally separate and spread across an immersive soundstage—making your music sound and feel as you know it should. The Bose connect app also helps you manage your devices, unlock Features and access future updates. You can easily charge the speaker via Micro-B USB port. And the auxiliary input allows you to connect to other audio sources. This mobile speaker is available in triple black or Lux gray. Included: sound link Revolve Bluetooth speaker; USB cable; wall charger.
feature_bullets: Deep, loud and immersive sound, with True 360 degree coverage
Built-in mic for speakerphone to take clear conference or personal calls out loud with a wireless range of approximately 30 feet.
Seamless aluminum body is durable and water resistant (IPX4)
Enjoy up to 12 hours of play time from a rechargeable, lithium-ion battery
Wireless Bluetooth pairing with voice prompts allows you to easily take calls and access your phone’s virtual assistant — hands free
Pair two SoundLink speakers together for party mode or stereo mode or use Bose SimpleSync technology to pair with a member of the Bose Smart Home Family to play in sync
